verses.text: 生命的活水主知道法利賽人聽見他收門徒和施洗比約翰更多

words.note: A biblical metaphor for spiritual life/Holy Spirit.
Here refers to Jesus.
A Jewish religious-political group in ancient Judea.

words.definition: to gather, to accept, to recruit
words.note: Here, 'to gather' or 'make' disciples.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: （其實不是耶穌親自施洗，而是他的門徒施洗），
就離開了猶太，再往加利利去。

words.note: Indicates a consequence or immediate action.

verses.text: 他必須經過撒瑪利亞。

words.definition: to pass through, to go through

verses.text: 於是到了撒瑪利亞的一座城，名叫敘加；這城靠近雅各給他兒子約瑟的那塊地。
在那裡有雅各井。耶穌因為旅途疲倦了，就坐在井旁；那時大約正午。
有一個撒瑪利亞婦人來打水。耶穌對她說：「請給我水喝。」
那時，他的門徒都進城買食物去了。
撒瑪利亞婦人對耶穌說：「你是猶太人，怎麼向我，一個撒瑪利亞婦人要水喝呢？」（原來猶太人和撒瑪利亞人不相往來。）

words.note: Formal/literary; implies no dealings or association.

verses.text: 耶穌回答她：「你若知道　神的恩賜，和對你說『請給我水喝』的是誰，你必早已求他，他也必早把活水賜給你了。」

words.note: A direct translation of Greek 'charisma', divine gift.
Metaphor for spiritual life or the Holy Spirit.
More formal/religious than 'give'.

verses.text: 婦人說：「先生，你沒有打水的器具，井又深，你從哪裡得活水呢？

words.note: A biblical term referring to fresh, flowing water, often symbolic of spiritual life.

verses.text: 我們的祖先雅各把這口井留給我們，他自己和子孫以及牲畜都喝這井的水，難道你比他還大嗎？」

words.definition: could it be that?, don't tell me
words.note: Used to pose a rhetorical question, often implying the answer is obvious or surprising.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「凡喝這水的，還要再渴；
人若喝我所賜的水，就永遠不渴。我所賜的水要在他裡面成為湧流的泉源，直湧到永生。」

words.note: Formal verb meaning to give, often from a superior to a subordinate.
Often used metaphorically in the Bible for the source of life or spiritual blessings.
A core theological concept in Christianity.

verses.text: 婦人說：「先生，請把這水賜給我，使我不渴，也不用來這裡打水。」
必須靠著聖靈按著真理敬拜　神耶穌說：「你去，叫你的丈夫，然後回到這裡來。」

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit of God.
The raised dot indicates a specific proper noun God.

verses.text: 婦人對他說：「我沒有丈夫。」耶穌說：「你說『沒有丈夫』是不錯的。
你以前有五個丈夫，現在有的並不是你的丈夫；你說這話是真的。」

words.note: Forms a nominalizer, meaning 'the one you have now'.

verses.text: 婦人說：「先生，我看出你是先知。

words.note: Common respectful address for a man.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.

verses.text: 我們的祖先在這山上敬拜　神，而你們卻說，敬拜的地方必須在耶路撒冷。」

words.note: The raised dot indicates a specific proper noun God.
Connects verb '敬拜' to noun '地方', meaning 'place of worship'.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「婦人，你應當信我，時候將到，那時你們敬拜父，不在這山上，也不在耶路撒冷。

words.note: Lit. 'respect and bow down'

verses.text: 你們敬拜你們所不知道的，我們卻敬拜我們所知道的，因為救恩是從猶太人出來的。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with a following verb.
Turns a clause into a noun phrase: 'that which you do not know'.
Turns a clause into a noun phrase: 'that which we know'.
Lit. 'saving grace'
Refers to the ethnic group, not a place.
Marks the preceding phrase as descriptive of the subject.

verses.text: 然而時候將到，現在就是了，那靠著聖靈按著真理敬拜父的，才是真正敬拜的人；因為父在尋找這樣敬拜他的人。

words.note: Refers to 'those people who'.
Lit. 'true principle'
Nominalizes the preceding phrase into 'those who worship...'
Connects an adjective/verb to a noun.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase into 'people who worship him this way'.

verses.text: 神是靈，敬拜他的必須靠著聖靈按著真理敬拜他。」

words.note: Nominalizes the preceding phrase into 'those who worship him'.

verses.text: 婦人說：「我知道那稱為基督的彌賽亞要來；他來了，要把一切都告訴我們。」

words.note: Transliteration of Greek 'Christos', meaning 'Anointed One'.
Links the descriptive phrase 'called Christ' to the following noun.
Transliteration of Hebrew 'Mashiach', meaning 'Anointed One'.
Introduces a direct object that is acted upon.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我這現在跟你說話的就是他。」

words.note: Forms a nominalized phrase or indicates an attribute.
Emphasizes the following statement.

verses.text: 正在這時候，門徒回來了，見耶穌和一個婦人說話，就很希奇；但是沒有人問：「你要甚麼？」或說：「你為甚麼跟她說話？」

words.definition: in the middle of, just then

words.note: Lit. 'door-follower', meaning a student or disciple.
Indicates completion of an action or a change of state.
Also written as 什麼.
Also written as 為什麼.

verses.text: 那婦人撇下了她的水罐，進到城裡去，對眾人說：

words.note: Indicates completion of an action.

verses.text: 「你們來，看看一個人，他把我所作的一切都說出來，難道這人就是基督嗎？」

words.note: Repetition indicates a casual or brief action.
Introduces the object of a verb, placing it before the verb.
Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '我所作' (what I have done).
Directional complement indicating disclosure.
Used to ask a rhetorical question, implying doubt or surprise.
Transforms a statement into a yes/no question.

verses.text: 眾人就出城，往耶穌那裡去。

words.note: Indicates a prompt consequence.

verses.text: 莊稼已經熟了當時，門徒對耶穌說：「拉比，請吃。」

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower', referring to a student or disciple.
Hebrew for 'my master', a title of respect for Jewish teachers.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我有食物吃，是你們所不知道的。」

words.note: Here, it nominalizes the phrase '你們所不知道'.

verses.text: 門徒就彼此說：「難道有人拿東西給他吃了嗎？」

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower', referring to a student or disciple.
Used to express rhetorical question implying the speaker expects a negative answer.
Literally 'east west', referring to miscellaneous items.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我的食物就是遵行差我來者的旨意，並且完成他的工作。

words.note: Refers to God's will or command.

verses.text: 你們不是說『還有四個月才到收穫的時候』嗎？我告訴你們，舉目向田觀看，莊稼已經熟了，可以收割了。

words.note: A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 收割的人得到工資，也積儲五穀直到永生，使撒種的和收割的一同快樂。

words.note: Indicates successful completion of an action.
Traditionally refers to five main grains, but generally means all grains.
Here, 'the one who sows'.
Here, 'the one who harvests'.

verses.text: 『這人撒種，那人收割』，這話是真的。
我派你們去收割你們所沒有勞苦的；別人勞苦，你們卻享受他們勞苦的成果。」

words.note: Often used to refer to 'what is done' or 'that which is'.
Here, 'that which you have not toiled for'.

verses.text: 因著那婦人作見證的話：「他把我所作的一切都說出來了」，那城裡就有許多撒瑪利亞人信了耶穌。

words.note: Marks a direct object placed before the verb.
Used to nominalize a verb phrase, referring to 'what I did'.
Here, 'all that which I did'.
Used as a resultative complement, indicating revelation.

verses.text: 於是他們來到耶穌那裡，求他和他們同住，耶穌就在那裡住了兩天。

words.note: Used before measure words, typically instead of 'èr'.

verses.text: 因著耶穌的話，信他的人就更多了。

words.note: Connects an adjective/clause to a noun, similar to 'who/which'

verses.text: 他們就對那婦人說：「現在我們信，不再是因為你的話，而是因為我們親自聽見了，知道這位真是世人的救主。」

words.note: Respectful measure word for people.

verses.text: 治好大臣的兒子兩天之後，耶穌離開那裡，往加利利去。

words.note: 好 acts as a resultative complement, indicating the healing was successful.
Often used in formal or classical contexts to link nouns, similar to 'de'.

verses.text: 耶穌自己說過：「先知在本鄉是不受尊敬的。」

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Often used in passive constructions like '受...尊敬' (receive...respect).
Used at the end of an adjectival phrase modifying an implied noun, or for emphasis.

verses.text: 耶穌到了加利利的時候，加利利人都歡迎他，因為他們曾經上耶路撒冷去過節，見過他所行的一切。

words.note: Used in the structure '...的時候' to indicate 'when...'
Combines with '加利利' to mean 'Galileans'.
Precedes a verb to refer to the object of the verb, often in a passive sense.

verses.text: 耶穌又到了加利利的迦拿，就是他變水為酒的地方。有一個大臣，他的兒子在迦百農患病。

words.note: Refers to a high-ranking official or royal attendant.
More formal than '生病', often used in medical or religious contexts.

verses.text: 他聽見耶穌從猶太到了加利利，就來見他，求他下去醫治他的兒子，因為他的兒子快要死了。
耶穌對他說：「你們若看不見神蹟奇事，總是不肯信。」

words.note: A common biblical idiom for miraculous events.

verses.text: 大臣說：「先生，求你趁我的孩子還沒有死就下去吧！」
耶穌告訴他：「回去吧，你的兒子好了。」那人信耶穌對他說的話，就回去了。
正下去的時候，他的僕人迎著他走來，說他的孩子好了。

words.note: A common word in biblical texts to refer to household servants or God's servants.

verses.text: 他就向僕人查問孩子是甚麼時候好轉的。他們告訴他：「昨天下午一點鐘，熱就退了。」
這父親就知道，那正是耶穌告訴他「你的兒子好了」的時候，他自己和全家就信了。
這是耶穌從猶太回到加利利以後所行的第二件神蹟。

words.note: Literally 'divine trace' or 'supernatural sign'.
